channel.title: Street Fighter IV
channel.description:
Anyone else excited about this game?
They have gone back to the basics, took the perfect system they had with Street Fighter II and have built on that without the extra rubbish. Have my sega saturn pad ready, can't wait! :D
http://uk.ps3.ign.com/articles/953/953811p1.html
One of the first reviews, the game is out on the 17th in NA and 20th in EU on PS3 and 360. PC later on in the year.

item.title: Street Fighter IV
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Anyway, yeah - got the game at the start of feb a few days before release and it is amazing.

It is more casual friendly than the older ones but still requires a bit of skill not to get owned online, the pacing is different and if you’re a vet of the older games you’ll have to adjust since the timing is different.

Lurrrrrrve it

Read full topic

item.title: Street Fighter IV
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

I prefer the old Mortal Kombat games, but I’m probably going to get this someday as Street Fighter is awesome.

Read full topic

item.title: Street Fighter IV
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:13, topic:261802”][quote author=Thug-life link=topic=345736.msg2667207#msg2667207 date=1234632782]

fighting games just suck, button bashin faggits
[/quote]Street Fighter is a big exception.

Ive played an older version previously and it didnt entice me, no beat em ups do, they are so bland. Thug-life 'sif im an idiot for hatin on beat em ups. MGS fag etc

You’re an idiot for not having a clue what you’re talking about, you can’t play street fighter by button mashing.

you can play ANY beat em up by button bashing[/quote]

I can play with by dick by button bashing, but it wont get me anywhere.

Read full topic

item.title: Street Fighter IV
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:16, topic:261802”]It is all about the combo’s, it isn’t like games like Tekken where combo’s will help you, but are not necessary. Street fighter, you’ll need to use proper combo’s to get anywhere.

Review:
http://www.gametrailers.com/player/45570.html?type=flv

EDIT:

Just got the game, wow…[/quote]How good is it?

item.title: Street Fighter IV
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

But you won’t win against anyone. Street fighter takes deep technical skill and months of practice (i’ll probably suck hard since i have not played a street fighter game for years).

A video preview of the game:
http://www.gametrailers.com/player/44749.html

item.title: Street Fighter IV
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

The franchise is like 25 years old, for the most part - it will be older people playing it. Street fighter has a massive cult like following, it requires so much skill that if you havn’t played a street fighter game before now and you buy this one and go online, you’ll just get owned everytime.

So yes casey, you’re wrong!!

Read full topic

item.title: Street Fighter IV
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Anyone else excited about this game?

They have gone back to the basics, took the perfect system they had with Street Fighter II and have built on that without the extra rubbish. Have my sega saturn pad ready, can’t wait!

IGN

Street Fighter IV UK Review - IGN

You've seen every screenshot, watched every trailer, prayed it would make it to console and rejoiced when Capcom duly obliged. The more enterprising of you may have even made the pilgrimage to the local arcade in order to worship at the latest altar...

One of the first reviews, the game is out on the 17th in NA and 20th in EU on PS3 and 360. PC later on in the year.

Read full topic
